trans-unit.source: Animates the value of a Vector3D property using linear interpolation between two values.
An animation updates the value of a property over a period of time.

An animation effect can be subtle, such as moving a <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Shape> a few pixels left and right, or dramatic, such as enlarging an object to 200 times its original size while spinning it and changing its color.
To create an animation in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], you associate an animation with an object's property value.
Target Values The Vector3DAnimation class creates a transition between two target values.

To set its target values, use its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.From%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.To%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.By%2A> properties.

The following table summarizes how the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.From%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.To%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.By%2A> properties may be used together or separately to determine an animation's target values.

|Properties specified|Resulting behavior| |--------------------------|------------------------| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.From%2A>|The animation progresses from the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.From%2A> property to the base value of the property being animated or to a previous animation's output value, depending on how the previous animation is configured.| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.From%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.To%2A>|The animation progresses from the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.From%2A> property to the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.To%2A> property.| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.From%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.By%2A>|The animation progresses from the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.From%2A> property to the value specified by the sum of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.From%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.By%2A> properties.| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.To%2A>|The animation progresses from the animated property's base value or a previous animation's output value to the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.To%2A> property.| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.By%2A>|The animation progresses from the base value of the property being animated or a previous animation's output value to the sum of that value and the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.By%2A> property.| > [!NOTE] > If you set both the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.To%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.By%2A> properties, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.To%2A> property takes precedence and the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.By%2A> property is ignored.
To use other interpolation methods or animate between more than two target values, use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimationUsingKeyFrames> object.
For information about applying multiple animations to a single property, see [Key-Frame Animations Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Freezable Features Because the Vector3DAnimation class inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Freezable>, Vector3DAnimation objects gain several special features, which include the following: they can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe.
For more information about the different features provided by <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation"></xref> class.
The Vector3Danimation is created with all properties set to their default value.
Initializes a new instance of the Vector3DAnimation class with the specified destination value and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration*>.
The ending value of this animation.
The new animation's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration*>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation"></xref> class that animates to the specified value over the specified duration and has the specified fill behavior.
The starting value for the animation is the base value of the property being animated or the output from another animation.
The destination value of the animation.
The length of time the animation takes to play from start to finish, once.
See the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration*> property for more information.
Specifies how the animation behaves when it is not active.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation"></xref> class that animates from the specified starting value to the specified destination value over the specified duration.
The starting value of the animation.
The destination value of the animation.
The length of time the animation takes to play from start to finish, once.
See the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration*> property for more information.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation"></xref> class that animates from the specified starting value to the specified destination value over the specified duration and has the specified fill behavior.
The starting value of the animation.
The destination value of the animation.
The length of time the animation takes to play from start to finish, once.
See the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration*> property for more information.
Specifies how the animation behaves when it is not active.
Gets or sets the total amount by which the animation changes its starting value.
The total amount by which the animation changes its starting value.
The default value is null.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.By*> dependency property.
To be added.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation"></xref>.
The new instance.
Gets or sets the easing function applied to this animation.
Easing functions allow you to create a variety of specialized animation effects including bouncing, spring oscillations, and various magnitude acceleration and deceleration animations.
The easing function applied to this animation.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.EasingFunction*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the animation's starting value.
The starting value of the animation.
The default value is null.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.From*> dependency property.
To be added.
Calculates a value that represents the current value of the property being animated, as determined by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation"></xref>.

If the `defaultOriginValue` is the first in the composition chain, this value will be the snapshot value (if one is available) or the base property value; otherwise this value will be the value returned by the previous animation in the chain with an <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock> that is not <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.Stopped%2A>.

The `defaultDestinationValue` is the base value if the animation is in the first composition layer of animations on a property; otherwise the value is the output value from the previous composition layer of animations for the property.
The suggested origin value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set start value.
The suggested destination value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set end value.

An <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> that generates the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentTime*> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress*> used by the animation.
The calculated value of the property, as determined by the current animation.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the target property's current value should be added to this animation's starting value.

If the animation has only one of its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.From%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.To%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.By%2A> properties set, setting this property has no effect.

## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| > [!NOTE] > This dependency property is unusual in that the identifier field for it comes from , and is shared by various derived classes.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the target property's current value should be added to this animation's starting value; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the animation's value accumulates when it repeats.

When this property is set to **true**, the animation's output values only accumulate when the animation's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior%2A> property causes it to repeat its simple duration.
It does not accumulate its values when it restarts because its parent repeated or because its clock was restarted from a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ClockController.Begin%2A> call.

## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| > [!NOTE] > This dependency property is unusual in that the identifier field for it comes from , and is shared by various derived classes.

**true** if the animation accumulates its values when its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior*> property causes it to repeat its simple duration. otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.
Gets or sets the animation's ending value.
The ending value of the animation.
The default value is null.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Vector3DAnimation.To*> dependency property.
To be added.
